description: Extension of third storey to provide additional floor of accommodation and stairwells, erection of a single storey pavilion to the rear, and four detached energy modules to either end of the building. Refurbishment of the exterior of the existing building.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 3 - All Non-road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) used during the course of the development that is within the scope of the GLA 'Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition' Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) dated July 2014, or any successor document, shall comply with the emissions requirements therein

Condition : 4 - No development above ground level shall take place until full details and samples of
all materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the
development hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the
local planning authority. Details must include a detailed schedule of materials, a
photographic sample board and rendered drawings, elevations and sections at a
sufficient scale (1:20 or 1:50) to illustrate how all external materials will appear
together.
The samples/details shall include:
(a) Cladding materials / render (including specifications where relevant);
(b) Tiles / roof covering; including parapet coping / capping materials, dormers and
canopies;
(c) Window types; and sectional drawings of reveals / sills / head details
(d) Balustrading treatment to balconies and roof areas (including details / sections /
materials); and handrails
(e) Any other materials/details / fittings to be used (including solar panels, extract
vents, rainwater goods, boiler flues etc.), with sections and on-site samples where
appropriate
The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details
and maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order), no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings/enclosures within the
curtilage of the site shall be carried out, other than as shown in the approved drawings, and no additional floor space shall be formed within the building(s) hereby permitted by means of internal horizontal division (new mezzanine level) without prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Condition : 6 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the Travel Plan hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the timescales specified therein, to include those parts identified as being implemented before and following occupation, unless alternative timescales are agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. The approved Travel Plan shall be monitored and reviewed in accordance with the agreed Travel Plan targets and timescales to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - The number of car parking spaces made available for the development hereby approved shall not exceed 186. The spaces shall be made available for use prior to the first occupation or use of the development hereby approved and shall be permanently
available for the occupiers and users of the premises and used for no other purpose.

Condition : 8 - Prior to the first use or occupation of the development hereby approved, full details (including a plan showing their location, elevation drawings, and manufacturers' specifications) of secure covered Long Stay cycle parking and Sheffield-style Short Stay
cycle parking facilities, that accord with the West London Cycle Parking Guidance for the occupants of, and visitors to the development, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 
The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use before the development is first occupied or brought into use, The approved facilities shall be thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 9 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until full details of the
Electric Vehicle Charging Point, capable of a minimum output of 7.2kW, are submitted
to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include
manufacturer's specifications and the number of spaces provided with active and
passive capabilities shall comply with the London Plan standards.
The charging point shall be installed in accordance with the approved details, with
photographic evidence submitted to the Local Planning Authority upon completion, and so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 11 - (a) The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy. 
(b) Within 3 months of first occupation of the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the local planning authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions, and achieved a 44% reduction in emissions.
(c) Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, suitable devices for the monitoring of the low and zero carbon technologies shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation. The data shall be made available to the local planning authority on request for a period of five years.

Condition : 12 - (a) The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the
submitted Sustainability Statement and accompanying BREEAM Pre-Assessment.

(b) Within three months of work starting on site, a BREEAM Design Stage certificate
and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be
submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority to show that an
?Excellent? (minimum score 70%) rating will be achieved.

(c) Within 3 months of the building(s) hereby permitted being occupied or brought into use, a BREEAM Post-Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority to show that an ?Excellent? (minimum score 70%) rating has been achieved.
